name: NewYorker
text: The director’s successors shouldn’t forget that his greatness depended on the worst and most bestial aspects of his character. https://t.co/IsE9F36EM9

name: NewYorker
text: On a new episode of #NewYorkerRadio, the legal scholar @JeannieSGersen discusses the call for Democrats to pack the Supreme Court. "There's nothing written in stone that says nine has to be the number," she says. #NewYorkerRadio https://t.co/zluQzsCc5d

name: NewYorker
text:
RT @dankaufman70: My latest for the @NewYorker is about the idling of Great Lakes Works, an enormous steel mill south of Detroit, and President Trump's broken promises to working-class voters. Deeply grateful to the @econhardship for their support of this piece. 

https://t.co/jhXIxBuw0h

name: NewYorker
text: Half of the community’s eligible voters haven’t cast their ballots yet. The work done by volunteers could prove decisive. https://t.co/ehCnETQVlm

name: NewYorker
text: “People are done with the circus”: Georgia voters and politicians discuss whether the state could go blue this year. https://t.co/UAPTy175cc

name: NewYorker
text: “Not all the Republicans are bad,” one former felon in Florida said. “But they don’t want us to vote. Because they think they’re going to lose.” https://t.co/Gf2Qob3rff

name: NewYorker
text: Pope Francis has complicated the Church’s position on human sexuality rather than clarified it. https://t.co/zVZM3SyHJm

name: NewYorker
text: Miles Taylor, who recently came forward as the author of “A Warning,” was an architect of criminal and cruel policies, @mashagessen writes; he deserves neither our charity nor our respect. https://t.co/hzs3wUsEpq

name: NewYorker
text: Adrianne Lenker often writes songs about time and loss—how to cling to what we need and let go of everything else. For her, @amandapetrusich writes, songwriting is a way of externalizing memories and pinning them in place, like a butterfly under glass. https://t.co/uxV8hPi3Si

name: NewYorker
text: Frog and Toad are “of the same sex, and they love each other,” the daughter of its author, Arnold Lobel, said. “It was quite ahead of its time in that respect.” https://t.co/FA8iyZpeXo

name: NewYorker
text:
During Donald Trump’s Presidency, the American flag has increasingly surfaced in connection with what an expert calls “extra-governmental groups: militias, paramilitary groups, groups identified as domestic terrorists.”
https://t.co/ier5cYNK7X
